ygData.subject: Re:What to buy?
ygData.msgSnippet: My apologies, Shelza, I was too quick to judge your intentions there. However I still think Harrick is far better off ignoring equipment for the moment.  The
ygData.messageBody:
My apologies, Shelza, I was too quick to judge your intentions there.
However I still think Harrick is far better off ignoring equipment for the
moment. The best equipment he could save up for right now would be:

Onyx earrings (2 agi) 5pp or so from Blackburrow
Spiked collar (ac3 3str) 5pp or so from Blackburrow
Lockjaw vest (ac12 5sta) 20-30pp from Oasis
Bracer of erolisi (ac5 5str) 25-30pp from Ocean of Tears

The Wu's gauntlets is not worth the money for him right now.

To be perfectly honest, Shelza, cured silk can stay in a lot of locations on a
monk until he or she hits the planes. Swap out to gear that gives you better
AC/HP than cured as you can afford it, but it's only going to make a
marginal improvement in combat performance for each piece of armor you
trade out. Levels and skills are what this game is really about.


Clarity Harvestmoon,
Karana

>First off, I am not twinked, every thing I got I earned the money for
>myself. As a monk this is really easy to do as monks dont have anything to
>spend money on but good armor. By the time I was 10th level, I had over 100
>plat saved, by the time I reached 18th I had bought and sold over 1000 plat
>worth of stuff, all done by money and items I have earned myself by selling
>loot or trade skills. One good one is mesh. Poke your head into Guk and
>you can just about get that stuff free off of the people in there....they
>have it comming out of thier ears. I would also rather have things like a
>spiked collar (easily obtainable in Black Burrow) than the cured silk
>counterpart. Man, I give someone valuble information, such as the location
>to where he can find a list of just about EVERY item a monk can wear, what
>the stats are and more importantly where he can get them and how much they
>usually sell for, so he can judge whether or not they are obtainable or not,
>and you jump me with an offensive letter like this? Learn some manners.
>What I am tired is, people like you jumping to conclutions when you have
>absolutely no idea what you are talking about. The worst part is, I wasn't
>insulting his armor, I was offering good, helpfull information. I never
>said ANYTHING like "oh well cure silk is crap compaired to Shiverback, you
>should get a full suit of that". If you knew anything, you yourself would
>know there are little peices people can pick up here and there to improve
>over something as rudimentary as cured silk is.
>Anyway, do yourself a favor, think before you type...and maybe you should
>check on stomped, you might find there is a peice of armor you could easily
>replace with something better. Getting eq doesn't always involve camping
>45+ mobs. Anyway.
>
>Shelza, 18th, Karana.
